meanings.sent1: The government decided to reregulate the prices of essential goods.
meanings.sent2: After receiving complaints, the company reregulated its customer service policies.
meanings.sent3: The teacher accidentally reregulated the classroom temperature to freezing cold.
meanings.sent4: She reregulated her daily routine, making sure to include time for exercise.
meanings.sent5: The chef carefully reregulated the seasoning in the dish to enhance the flavor.

meanings.sent1: The mechanic had to reregulate the engine to improve its performance.
meanings.sent2: The therapist reregulated the therapy sessions to better meet the patient's needs.
meanings.sent3: The child kept trying to reregulate the volume on the TV remote, much to the family's amusement.
meanings.sent4: She reregulated her study schedule to allocate more time for difficult subjects.
meanings.sent5: The farmer reregulated the irrigation system to ensure each crop received enough water.
